% Generated by roxygen2 (4.1.0): do not edit by hand
% Please edit documentation in R/visVp.r
\name{visVp}
\alias{visVp}
\title{Function to create viewports for multiple supra-hexagonal grids}
\usage{
visVp(height = 7, xdim = 1, ydim = 1, colNum = 1, rowNum = 1,
gp = grid::gpar())
}
\arguments{
\item{height}{a numeric value specifying the height of device}

\item{xdim}{an integer specifying x-dimension of the grid}

\item{ydim}{an integer specifying y-dimension of the grid}

\item{colNum}{an integer specifying the number of columns}

\item{rowNum}{an integer specifying the number of rows}

\item{gp}{an object of class gpar, typically the output from a call to
the function gpar (i.e., a list of graphical parameter settings)}
}
\value{
\item{vpnames}{an R object of "viewport" class}
}
\description{
\code{visVp} is supposed to create viewports, which describe
rectangular regions on a graphics device and define a number of
coordinate systems for each of supra-hexagonal grids.
}
\note{
none
}
\examples{
# 1) create 5x5 viewports
vpnames <- visVp(colNum=5, rowNum=5)

# 2) look at names of these viewports
vpnames
}
\seealso{
\code{\link{visHexMulComp}}, \code{\link{visCompReorder}}
}
